text: Having walked through a valley, Mr. Keuner soon warned that his feet were slipping in the water. And at that time he realized that his valley was really a sea-breeze, and that the time of the storm was approaching. He sat down immediately to see if he could find a boat, and he did not move from the spot while he waited. But when none came, he gave up hope and trusted that the water would not rise any further. Only when he reached the barbershop, he also abandoned this hope and began to swim. He had discovered that he himself was a boat. FIN
title: El señor Keuner y la marea
author: Bertolt Brecht
